entry.title: REMINDER: If you're in line to vote, STAY in line. In...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

REMINDER: If you're in line to vote, STAY in line. In Colorado, if you're in line by 7 p.m. you have the right to register to vote and VOTE!

If you have any problems or questions on Election Day, call the Election Protection Hotline at 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

REMINDER: If you're in line when the polls close, STAY in line. In Colorado, if you're in line before 7 pm you still have the right to register to vote and VOTE! Report intimidation or other issues to 866-OUR-VOTE (866-687-8683) and 888-VA-Y-VOTE (888-839-8682).TranslatedIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

entry.title: ACLU of ColoradoColorado Secretary of State's OfficeToday is the last day to vote! Return your ballot or vote in-person by 7pm tonight!...
entry.content:
ACLU of ColoradoColorado Secretary of State's Office

Today is the last day to vote! Return your ballot or vote in-person by 7pm tonight! Robocalls/texts with incorrect election info have been reported across the c...ountry, though very limited numbers reported in Colorado. Visit http://GoVoteColorado.gov for correct election information. #FactsAreBetter

entry.title: If you think you've encountered voter disinformation...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

If you think you've encountered voter disinformation online, screenshot and report to https://reportdisinfo.org/. Do not reply or share voting misinformation ‚Äî even if you are debunking. The more engagements, the more users will see it.

Voter disinformation can look like posts or content with false information on deadlines, dates, voting location, and voter eligibility, especially when in an aggressive tone or when threatening prosecution. For more tips on how to best report voter disinformation, visit https://reportdisinfo.org/

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

entry.title: Colorado voters with disabilities, you have the right to access...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado voters with disabilities, you have the right to access in-person accommodations

‚óè Each polling place is required to be accessible to persons with disabilities.
‚óè If you are unable to sign your name, you have the right to vote without signing your name.
‚óè If you are a voter with Visual Impairments, you are entitled to a ballot that your assistive technology can read. ...
‚óè If you cannot read, see, or operate the voting machine because of a disability, you have the right to receive assistance from any individual you choose, or an election official.

For more accommodation info: https://bit.ly/3ezyYeZ

See MoreIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

entry.title: Proposition 115 is intentionally confusing and aims to ban...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Proposition 115 is intentionally confusing and aims to ban abortion later in pregnancy with no exceptions for health or individual circumstances. Read more about one family's heartbreaking story and vote #NoOn115 [

https://aclu-co.org/no-on-115-one-familys-story/

entry.title: REMINDER: If you're visiting a polling place in person...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

REMINDER: If you're visiting a polling place in person today, clothing and accessories with political messages on them are not allowed. This includes pins, t-shirts, hats, or other apparel that display a candidate or any issue on the ballot.

You have the right to vote free of intimidation or coercion.

For voting help, call or text the Election Protection Hotline: 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683).

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

entry.title: If you are voting in-person and your voting eligibility is being...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

If you are voting in-person and your voting eligibility is being challenged or you forgot your ID, you have the right to cast a provisional ballot. Provisional ballots ensure that every qualified and registered voter can cast a vote that will be counted. You will fill out an affidavit and receive a receipt with instructions on how to follow-up on your ballot status.

Report issues to 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

entry.title: Know your rights. You have the right to vote free of...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Know your rights. You have the right to vote free of intimidation or interference. If you suspect voter intimidation:

‚úÖ Prioritize your own safety
‚úÖ Document the incident with as much detail as possible
‚úÖ Report to 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA, your county clerk, and voting@aclu-co.org

...

Find your county clerk: https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/CountyClerkRosterWebsite.pdf

See MoreIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

entry.title: Today is Election Day! All ballots must be received by 7 P.M....
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Today is Election Day! All ballots must be received by 7 P.M. TODAY, November 3rd.

For assistance or to report issues call: 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or text 303-502-9038.

Find your polling location: https://justvotecolorado.org/

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info
